verses.verse: Is there not<WH3808> an appointed time<WH6635> to man<WH582> upon<WH5921> earth?<WH776> are not his days<WH3117> also like the days<WH3117> of a hireling?<WH7916>
As a servant<WH5650> earnestly desireth<WH7602> the shadow,<WH6738> and as a hireling<WH7916> looketh for<WH6960> the reward of his work: <WH6467>
So <WH3651> am I made to possess<WH5157> months<WH3391> of vanity,<WH7723> and wearisome<WH5999> nights<WH3915> are appointed<WH4487> to me.

When <WH518> I lie down,<WH7901> I say,<WH559> When<WH4970> shall I arise,<WH6965> and the night<WH6153> be gone?<WH4059> and I am full<WH7646> of tossings to and fro<WH5076> unto<WH5704> the dawning of the day.<WH5399>
My flesh<WH1320> is clothed<WH3847> with worms<WH7415> and clods<WH1487> of dust;<WH6083> my skin<WH5785> is broken,<WH7280> and become loathsome.<WH3988>
My days<WH3117> are swifter<WH7043> than<WH4480> a weaver's shuttle,<WH708> and are spent<WH3615> without<WH657> hope.<WH8615>
O remember<WH2142> that<WH3588> my life<WH2416> is wind:<WH7307> mine eye<WH5869> shall no<WH3808> more<WH7725> see<WH7200> good.<WH2896>
The eye<WH5869> of him that hath seen<WH7210> me shall see<WH7789> me no<WH3808> more: thine eyes<WH5869> are upon me, and I am not.<WH369>
As the cloud<WH6051> is consumed<WH3615> and vanisheth away:<WH1980> so<WH3651> he that goeth down<WH3381> to the grave<WH7585> shall come up<WH5927> no<WH3808> more.
He shall return<WH7725> no<WH3808> more<WH5750> to his house,<WH1004> neither<WH3808> shall his place<WH4725> know<WH5234> him any more.<WH5750>

Therefore <WH1571> I<WH589> will not<WH3808> refrain<WH2820> my mouth;<WH6310> I will speak<WH1696> in the anguish<WH6862> of my spirit;<WH7307> I will complain<WH7878> in the bitterness<WH4751> of my soul.<WH5315>
Am I<WH589> a sea,<WH3220> or<WH518> a whale,<WH8577> that<WH3588> thou settest<WH7760> a watch<WH4929> over<WH5921> me?
When <WH3588> I say,<WH559> My bed<WH6210> shall comfort<WH5162> me, my couch<WH4904> shall ease<WH5375> my complaint;<WH7879>
Then thou scarest<WH2865> me with dreams,<WH2472> and terrifiest<WH1204> me through visions:<WH4480> <WH2384>
So that my soul<WH5315> chooseth<WH977> strangling,<WH4267> and death<WH4194> rather than my life.<WH4480> <WH6106>
I loathe<WH3988> it; I would not<WH3808> live<WH2421> always:<WH5769> let me alone;<WH2308> <WH4480> for<WH3588> my days<WH3117> are vanity.<WH1892>
What <WH4100> is man,<WH582> that<WH3588> thou shouldest magnify<WH1431> him? and that<WH3588> thou shouldest set<WH7896> thine heart<WH3820> upon<WH413> him?
And that thou shouldest visit<WH6485> him every morning,<WH1242> and try<WH974> him every moment?<WH7281>
How long<WH4100> wilt thou not<WH3808> depart<WH8159> from<WH4480> me, nor<WH3808> let me alone<WH7503> till<WH5704> I swallow down<WH1104> my spittle?<WH7536>

I have sinned;<WH2398> what<WH4100> shall I do<WH6466> unto thee, O thou preserver<WH5341> of men?<WH120> why<WH4100> hast thou set<WH7760> me as a mark<WH4645> against thee, so that I am<WH1861> a burden<WH4853> to<WH5921> myself?

And why<WH4100> dost thou not<WH3808> pardon<WH5375> my transgression,<WH6588> and take away<WH5674> <WH853> mine iniquity?<WH5771> for<WH3588> now<WH6258> shall I sleep<WH7901> in the dust;<WH6083> and thou shalt seek me in the morning,<WH7836> but I shall not<WH369> be.
